Posts.Content: Hi everyone I had a sentinel node biopsy on Tuesday. Felt a bit sore but its fine now, thing is I've had a stiff neck since, can anyone help with types of relief for me please, hope all are having a good day
Posts.Title: Sentinel node

Posts.Content: I'm sorry to hear your diagnosis, but try to look at the positive your CT and bone scan are clear so that's good news, and once your treatment starts you will feel better and that things are moving ahead, you will have ups and downs and you'll find this site is a great help xx
Posts.Title: Mars den hospital Sutton

Posts.Content: Hi all, just a small rant really to get it off my chest... Pardon the pun, a brief history of my breast cancer, I found a lump in April I was referred to breast screening, within 3 weeks had needle biopsies ( was still working) another 2 weeks waiting for results, turned out I had breast cancer, I bit of a shock, then the whirlwind started, and I'm sure you will all know the path, nuclear medicine, scans, lymph removed, to determine, what's what, I had a full right breast mastectomy with implant which I had for 3 weeks, but sadly my body rejected, I'm now happy with my body minus boob, The main point that is getting my back up is, I was off work all told 4 1/2 months, mainly due to surgery, I'm not one to be off work, and my sickness record is good, think I'd been off once in two years, I work as a nurse in the NHS, and have been back on phased return, all wells but I got told by my line manager I was on a stage 3 sickness, i know she is just following policies, I will be on this stage for 3 months if I'm not off in that time period, I don't want a medal or any special treatment, but I can not promise I'm not going to be off, as being on tamoxifen I'm feeling worn out sometimes, I'm just a bit shocked to the lack of understanding towards the emotional effects its had on me, has anyone else had similar moments
Posts.Title: Returning to work

Posts.Content: C it no wonder you are stressed, I do hope you can find some resolve to family life, as for work I agree don't go back to work until you feel you can handle it, because it will be something small that will push you, as this is with me xxx
